level.heading: MONTE CARLO NIGHT PARTY RAFFLES (ยง 30-1606)

level.text: A licensed organization may conduct a raffle in conjunction with a Monte Carlo night party where the following is present:
There shall be no pre-sale of tickets. All tickets shall be sold during the event;
The drawing shall be held at the Monte Carlo night party where the tickets were sold;
The person shall be present in order to win;
The prize shall be awarded at the Monte Carlo night party in which the tickets were sold; and
The aggregate value of the prize does not exceed five hundred dollars ($500).
On the application, the licensed organization shall register the raffle by indicating its intention to hold a raffle.

If a licensed organization desires to have a raffle and the aggregate value of the prize is more than five hundred dollars ($500) or the licensed organization desires to pre-sell the tickets, then the licensed organization shall obtain a raffle license pursuant to Chapter 12 of this title.

level.heading: HISTORICAL NOTE
level.text: Prior to May 20, 1988, the D.C. Lottery and Charitable Games Control Board published Final Rulemaking at 29 DCR 5018, 5039 (November 12, 1982).
